column1: Jacaltenango is a town and municipality situated in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is located in a valley surrounded by the Sierra Madre Mountains.
Jacaltenango serves as the municipal seat for the surrounding municipality of the same name.

column3: 500 but at the 2018 census the town's population has decreased to 22

column1: Its economy is based mainly on agricultural products
column2: especially coffee. Jacaltenango exports about 95% of its agricultural production. Jacaltenango has six schools: three elementary and three high schools

column1: After the Spanish conquest of Guatemala in the 1520s
column2: the "Presentación de Guatemala" Mercedarian province was formed in 1565; originally
column3: the order of the Blessed Virgin Mary of Mercy had gotten from bishop Francisco Marroquín several doctrines in the Sacatepéquez and Chimaltenango valleys
column4: close to the capital Santiago de los Caballeros de Guatemala
column5: but they traded those with friars of the Order of Preachers in exchange for the doctrines those had in the Sierra de los Cuchumatanes area. During the first part of the 17th century they also had doctrine in four towns close to the city of Santiago
column6: which eventually became city neighborhoods: Espíritu Santo
column8: San Jerónimo and San Anton —which was the capital of the Mercedarians
column9: where they had their convent and where their comendador lived.According to bishop Juan de las Cabezas' memoir in 1613 and the bishop Pedro Cortés y Larraz parish visit minutes from 1770
column10: the Mercedarians came to have nine doctrines
column12: which were: Santa Ana de Malacatán
column15: Nuestra Señora de la Purificación de Jacaltenango
column16: Nuestra Señora de la Candelaria de Chiantla
column22: due to the borbon reforms implemented by the Spanish kings
column23: the Mercedarins - and the rest of the regular clergy for that matter - had to transfer their doctrines to the secular clergy
column24: thus losing their Jacaltaenango convent and annexed doctrines.

column1: Jacaltenango has a subtropical highland climate (Köppen: Cwb).
